climbs.name: Ascend to Lycra and Sweat
climbs.fa: P “Bokkie” Hairsine, L "Rukas" Fodor, J "Party" Hardy 2019

content.description:
From the belay bolt step slightly left and ascend the short wall with two bolts. Follow a low angle crack and step between two huge boulders. Finish at the steep step with a bolt. Belay off the large tree. 



Hike to the top of Pulpit Rock and rappel off two rings at the North East edge of the lookout. Or alternatively walk down the mossy ramp at the edge of the lookout(not recommended).

https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=442357736559161&set=pcb.430569491057136

Bolts

P1: 5.8 Start up the left hand (south-facing) slab and veer right continuing over blocks to a traverse. Finish below the dark slab at a station. (25m)

P2:  5.6 or 5.10a To avoid rope drag, use long slings on the first 2 bolts of this pitch. Step right into the dirty gully and then back left onto the arête. After three bolts the route splits – go right for the 5.6 variation or left for the 5.10a. Finish at a station above a short slab. (25m) 

P3: 5.10a Step left and then back right up to a roof and pull through this using a giant hand hold (crux). Continue to the chains. (26m)



The climb starts from on the left face off the main belay pad.

Bolts - 12

From the anchors, step directly up onto the slab, then balance and finesse past the first two bolts. Trend right past the key crystal (the “diamond”) to a good finger ledge. Continue up to the open book corner and muscle your way to the top of it before stepping left onto easier ground that leads to the anchor up and right. Finish on either the third pitch of “The Engagement” or “The Date.”



On the steepest part of the slab in the middle of the wall directly right of P2 of "The Fling". To access climb the first pitch of "The Date" or "The Fling". Finish on either the third pitch of “The Engagement” or “The Date.”

Bolts

The left most climb on the wall.

P1: 5.10b - Climb the first four bolts of The Date and then at the open-book corner, step left and finesse your way up the slab (4 bolts) to the large ledge where you'll find an anchor. (26m)

P2: 5.10b - Climb straight up to the roof and then step to the right past five bolts. Continue up the easy slab to the anchors. (22m)

P3: 5.10b Follow the ramp on the left through two slab roofs (second one is the crux) onto easier ground above. Anchor at the top. (28m)


Start as for First Date. 
bolts.

Climb the arête directly above the twin-ringed belay using several side pulls. The route rejoins Four on the Side just before the belay station.



An alternate third pitch of "Four on the Side" or climb "We met on Vernon Street" and finish by clipping the bolt between the chain belay and the base of the ladder then stepping across the gully to the ring anchors to the right and slightly down.

Bolts and fixed anchors

P1: 5.9 Follow the bolts to a bulge and pull the move up and to the left. Finish at the same chains as the first pitch of “The Date.” (22m) 

P2: 5.11b From the anchor either step down and left or delicately traverse left on a small ledge. Using the arete and a toe/heel hook gently pull up onto the slab(technical crux).  Follow the arête to a good rest then fling your body around the left side of the arête and into a corner, don't miss the undercling. Climb the thin finger crack(physical crux) clipping the bolts on the slab then step back right onto the face. Finish on the last 2 bolts of P2 of "The Engagement". (20m) 

P3: Finish on either the third pitch of “The Date” or “The Engagement.”



From the belay platform at the base of Pulpit Rock start on the right hand (west-facing) wall.

Bolts and chain anchors

P1: 5.9 Traverse up and left through the lichen and dirt. (27m) 

P2: 5.10a Side pull off the belay to reach the large detached flake. Continue up through progressively cleaner rock. Ignore the first ring bolts you see and traverse 5 meters right of them over easy slab to the two-bolt anchor below the corner. (28m) 

P3: 5.10c The money pitch! Climb up the corner to the diving board and then high step through the roof (crux). Continue up the corner and over the low-angle rock to the anchor. (28m) 

P4: 5.10a Follow the ramps up and right to the roof. Use the finger crack to power through it then continue on easy terrain to the top anchor. (28m)



The access for the bottom pitches of this route are different than the rest on Pulpit as it starts lower on the face. Follow the regular approach onto the talus slop and look for the first rough track on your right. Follow this for 20 meters, past a small, mossy cliff, to the base of the gully and a belay bolt. It is possible to traverse right from the P1 anchor of "The Date" through the gully past the ring bolts to the 2 bolt anchor of P2 "Four on the Side".

Bolts

climbs.name: If You Leave Me, Can I Come Too?

content.description:
From the belay bolt trend slightly right and up. At the second bolt move back left. Step up onto the slab(crux) and balance your way to a fourth bolt. The grade eases in the second half of the route. Finish at a chain anchor.



Hike to the top of Pulpit Rock and rappel off a chain anchor at the North East edge of the lookout. Or alternatively walk down the mossy ramp at the edge of the lookout(not recommended).

Bolts

climbs.name: Last Days of the Honeymoon
climbs.fa: P (Bokkie) Hairsine, J el Damasi and C Halloran  2018

content.description:
P1 5.10b From the twin bolts step right around the buttress 3 meters and swing up onto the rock using a jug and side pull. A rising traverse to the left is the crux. Up a corner and onto a shelf then easily left to the station. (22m)

P2 5.9 Fine footwork and side pulls lead to the edge of the giant hanging plate. A clean slab then a steep step lead to easier ground. (27m)



Easiest approach by walking to the top of Pulpit Rock lookout, stashing your walking shoes and bag and rapping from the anchor station 5 metres right (looking outwards) of the most north easterly warning sign on the lookout. The twin ring rap station is hidden beneath a small overhang. Follow the bolts to a second station 27 m down and then rap again bearing left to a dual bolt starting station. 

https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=442357736559161&set=pcb.430569491057136

Bolts and fixed anchors

climbs.name: The Long Haul
climbs.fa: Yann Troutet, Chantal Guillemette, Geneviève Pomerleau. June 2022.

content.description:
The Long Haul, 5.10- mixed, ~130m, FA: Yann Troutet, Chantal Guillemette, Geneviève Pomerleau. June 2022.

Finding its way up the tallest part of Pulpit Rock, this route first hugs the edge of the gully that splits the lower half of Pulpit Rock, then tackles the steepest part of the headwall. Start where the approach trail skirts the toe of Pulpit Rock. All pitches are mixed; gear sizes up to 3 inches. Small cams and extendable quickdraws are useful. All belays have twin rappel ring-bolts. Note: the first four pitches can be climbed in two ropelengths.

P1: Start right off the trail at the toe of the cliff. Follow a thin crack (gear) through low angle rolls, to the bolt-protected slab and a belay ledge. 5.5 ~28m

P2: Climb up the broken arête, into a niche. Pull out right (bolt), to a short corner and anchors. Belay on a small flat perch. 5.7 ~17m

P3: Pull onto the large ledge. Hand-traverse left into the obvious corner system. Rock fins and shallow corners lead up to a small ledge and anchors. 5.7 ~20m

P4: Step left and follow the obvious left-slanting seams through the slab, to a huge sloping ledge and anchors. 5.8 ~20m

P5: Hike up some steps, to the back of the large corner. Pull up, then balance onto the steep left face of the corner, clipping 3 bolts. Continue up a series of corners and splitter cracks, to a belay ledge off to the right. 5.10- ~ 25m

P6: Continue up the obvious weakness, to the large sloping ledge. High-step into the right-facing corner (bolt). Dance up the steep terrain above, past two more bolts, emerging just below the onlooking hikers. Belay at a two bolt anchors. 5.10- ~ 25m

Descent: can be done by rappelling down the route, but walking off is recommended. 



Start where the approach trail skirts the toe of Pulpit Rock. 

All pitches are mixed; gear sizes up to 3 inches.

A 1 pitch alternative start to "The Date" or "The Fling". Follow the bolts onto the slab and through a steep corner. (If you’re so inclined, take a .75 cam to protect the move.) Pass 3 more bolts to the anchors atop the first pitch of “The Date.” Continue on to the top on “The Fling,” “The Date,” or “The Diamond.”



Starts 5 meters right of the platform at the base of “The Fling” at a horn of rock atop a large boulder. There are bolts to belay from at the bottom.

Blots

Topo: http://www.wonowmedia.com/rock-guide-updates-for-pulpit-rock-in-nelson-bc/
